intro: Pleopogon setosum, commonly known as the hairy pleopogon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences composed of multiple bright yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
